fact_check_explanation_title: Ministry of Justice corrects corrected overcrowding figures
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Ministry of Justice issued corrected figures for prison overcrowding in last week. Unfortunately, these figures were wrong.

fact_check_explanation_title: Two prisoners to a cell designed for one: how many are living in overcrowded conditions?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Two prisoners occupy a cell intended for one. How many are living in 'crowded accommodation'? Some prisons have been counting only one prisoner.

fact_check_explanation_title: Did the EU misspend enough money to build 10 new hospitals?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The EU misspent €7 billion in 2013. Would that have paid for 10 new hospitals?

fact_check_explanation_title: Is the number of unlawfully large infant classes falling?
fact_check_explanation_summary: What impact are increasing pupil numbers having on infant class sizes? Taking into account both lawfully and unlawfully large classes, there are growing numbers with 31 or more pupils.

fact_check_explanation_title: UK remains one of fastest growing 'major advanced' economies
fact_check_explanation_summary: The OECD have forecast that the UK will be the fastest growing G7 economy in 2015, while the IMF have it in second place.
Britain does have a structural deficit, but that doesn't just mean that the government spends more than it receives.

fact_check_explanation_title: Guardian app hasn't started notifying users of corrections to pieces
fact_check_explanation_summary: Last week we wrote about a notification sent to mobile users of a correction from the Guardian news app, which we thought was a correction to an article.

fact_check_explanation_title: Inequality, trade and productivity: factchecking Prime Minister's Questions
fact_check_explanation_summary: We've checked claims from PMQs on inequality, trade and productivity

fact_check_explanation_title: Did Labour vote to stop 16 and 17 year olds voting in the EU referendum?
fact_check_explanation_summary: With the passing of yesterday's House of Commons vote on the EU Referendum Bill, there's already been disagreement over Labour's position on the proposals.

fact_check_explanation_title: Are foreign criminals using human rights to avoid being deported?
fact_check_explanation_summary: 133 foreign criminals were allowed to stay in the country out of respect for their human rights in 2013.

fact_check_explanation_title: Nurse shortages: factchecking the last government's record
fact_check_explanation_summary: Jeremy Hunt and Andy Burnham have debated the cause of rising spending on temporary nurses. We check their claims on spending, nurse numbers, and Mid Staffs

fact_check_explanation_title: Is the Guardian the first news app to send push notifications to readers about corrections?
fact_check_explanation_summary: This week the Guardian app popped up with a notification alerting phone users to a correction to one of its pieces. It's a very good way of making sure readers …
